verses.latin: Paulus servus Iesu Christi, vocatus apostolus, segregatus in evangelium Dei,
verses.english: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, set apart for the Gospel of God,

verses.latin: quod ante promiserat per prophetas suos in scripturis sanctis
verses.english: which God had promised beforehand through His prophets in the Holy Scriptures,

verses.latin: de Filio suo, qui factus est ei ex semine David secundum carnem,
verses.english: concerning His Son, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh,

verses.latin: qui praedestinatus est Filius Dei in virtute secundum spiritum sanctificationis ex resurrectione mortuorum Iesu Christi Domini nostri,
verses.english: who was appointed the Son of God in power according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead: Jesus Christ our Lord,

verses.latin: per quem accepimus gratiam et apostolatum pro obediendum fidei in omnibus gentibus pro nomine eius,
verses.english: through whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations for His name's sake,

verses.latin: in quibus estis et vos vocati Iesu Christi:
verses.english: among whom you also are the called of Jesus Christ:

verses.latin: omnibus qui sunt Romae, dilectis Dei, vocatis sanctis. Gratia vobis et pax a Deo Patre nostro, et Domino Iesu Christo.
verses.english: To all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Primo quidem gratias ago Deo meo per Iesum Christum pro omnibus vobis: quia fides vestra annuntiatur in universo mundo.
verses.english: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, because your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world.

verses.latin: Testis enim mihi est Deus, cui servio in spiritu meo in evangelio Filii eius, quod sine intermissione memoriam vestri facio,
verses.english: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the Gospel of His Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers,

verses.latin: semper in orationibus meis obsecrans, si quo modo aliquando prosperum iter habeam in voluntate Dei venire ad vos.
verses.english: always in my prayers making request, if by any means now at length I may have a prosperous journey, by the will of God, to come unto you.

verses.latin: Desidero enim videre vos, ut aliquid impertiar vobis gratiae spiritalis ad confirmandos vos:
verses.english: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end you may be established;

verses.latin: id est, simul consolari in vobis per eam quae invicem est fidem vestram atque meam.
verses.english: that is, that I may be comforted together with you, by the mutual faith both of you and me.

verses.latin: Nolo autem vos ignorare fratres: quia saepe proposui venire ad vos (et prohibitus sum usque adhuc) ut aliquem fructum habeam et in vobis, sicut et in ceteris gentibus.
verses.english: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that I have often purposed to come unto you (and have been hindered hitherto), that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.

verses.latin: Graecis ac barbaris, sapientibus et insipientibus debitor sum:
verses.english: To the Greeks and to the barbarians, to the wise and to the unwise, I am a debtor.

verses.latin: ita quod in me promptum est et vobis qui Romae estis evangelizare.
verses.english: So, as much as is in me, I am ready to preach the gospel to you also that are at Rome.

verses.latin: Non enim erubesco evangelium: virtus enim Dei est in salutem omni credenti, Iudaeo primum et Graeco.
verses.english: For I am not ashamed of the gospel: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth, to the Jew first, and to the Greek.

verses.latin: Iustitia enim Dei in eo revelatur ex fide in fidem: sicut scriptum est: Iustus ex fide vivit.
verses.english: For in it the justice of God is revealed, from faith unto faith: as it is written: The just man liveth by faith.

verses.latin: Revelatur enim ira Dei de caelo super omnem impietatem et iniustitiam hominum eorum, qui veritatem Dei in iniustitia detinent:
verses.english: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and injustice of those men that detain the truth of God in injustice.

verses.latin: quia quod notum est Dei, manifestum illis est. Deus enim illis manifestavit.
verses.english: Because that which is known of God is manifest in them. For God hath manifested it unto them.

verses.latin: Invisibilia enim ipsius, a creatura mundi, per ea quae facta sunt, intellecta conspiciuntur:sempiterna quoque eius virtus et divinitas: ita ut sint inexcusabiles.
verses.english: For the invisible things of Him, from the creation of the world, are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made; His eternal power also and divinity: so that they are inexcusable.

verses.latin: quia cum cognovissent Deum, non sicut Deum glorificaverunt aut gratias egerunt: sed evanuerunt in cogitationibus suis, et obscuratum est insipiens cor eorum.
verses.english: Because that, when they had known God, they have not glorified Him as God, or given thanks; but became vain in their thoughts, and their foolish heart was darkened.

verses.latin: dicentes se esse sapientes, stulti facti sunt.
verses.english: For professing themselves to be wise, they became fools.

verses.latin: Et mutaverunt gloriam incorruptibilis Dei in similitudinem imaginis corruptibilis hominis, et volucrum, et quadrupedum, et serpentium.
verses.english: And they changed the glory of the incorruptible God into the likeness of the image of a corruptible man, and of birds, and of fourfooted beasts, and of serpents.

verses.latin: Propter quod tradidit illos Deus in desideria cordis eorum, in immunditiam, ut contumeliis afficiant corpora sua inter semetipsos:
verses.english: Wherefore God gave them up to the desires of their heart, unto uncleanness, to dishonor their own bodies among themselves.

verses.latin: qui mutaverunt veritatem Dei in mendacium: et coluerunt et servierunt creaturae prae creatori, qui est benedictus in saecula. Amen.
verses.english: Who changed the truth of God into a lie; and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator, Who is blessed for ever. Amen.

verses.latin: Propterea tradidit illos Deus in passiones ignominiae. Nam feminae eorum immutaverunt naturalem usum in eum usum qui contra naturam est.
verses.english: For this cause God delivered them up to shameful affections. For their women have changed the natural use into that use which is against nature.

verses.latin: Similiter autem et masculi, relicto naturali usu feminae, exarserunt in desideriis suis in invicem, masculi in masculos turpitudinem operantes, et mercedem quam oportuit, erroris sui in semetipsis recipientes.
verses.english: And the men in like manner, leaving the natural use of the women, have burned in their lusts one towards another, men with men working that which is filthy, and receiving in themselves the recompense which was due to their error.

verses.latin: Et sicut non probaverunt Deum habere in notitia, tradidit illos Deus in reprobum sensum, ut faciant ea quae non conveniunt,
verses.english: And as they liked not to have God in their knowledge, God delivered them up to a reprobate sense, to do those things which are not convenient;

verses.latin: repletos omni iniquitate, nequitia, avaritia, malitia; plenos invidia, homicidio, contentione, dolo, malignitate; susurrones,
verses.english: Being filled with all iniquity, malice, fornication, avarice, wickedness; full of envy, murder, contention, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

verses.latin: detractores, Deo odibiles, contumeliosos, superbos, elatos, inventores malorum, parentibus non obedientes,
verses.english: Detractors, hateful to God, contumelious, proud, haughty, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

verses.latin: insipientes, inconperantes, sine affectione, sine foedere, sine misericordia.
verses.english: Foolish, dissolute, without affection, without fidelity, without mercy.

verses.latin: Qui cum iustitiam Dei cognovissent, non intellexerunt quoniam qui talia agunt, morte sunt digni: et non solum qui faciunt, sed etiam qui consentiunt facientibus.
verses.english: Who, having known the justice of God, did not understand that they who do such things, are worthy of death; and not only they that do them, but they also that consent to them that do them.

verses.latin: Propter quod inexcusabilis es, o homo, omnis qui judicas: in quo enim judicas alterum, te ipsum condemn as: eadem enim agis, quae judicas.
verses.english: You, therefore, are without excuse, every man who judges others. In that in which you judge another, you condemn yourself, because you practice the same sins that you judge.

verses.latin: Scimus enim quoniam judicium Dei est secundum veritatem in eos qui talia agunt.
verses.english: We know that God’s judgment is according to truth against those who commit such sins.

verses.latin: Existimas autem hoc, o homo, qui judicas eos qui talia agunt, et facis ea, quia tu effugies judicium Dei?
verses.english: Do you think that you, a man who judges those who do such things, yet practices them yourself, will escape the judgment of God?

verses.latin: An divitiarum bonitatis ejus, et patientiae, et longanimitatis contemnis? Ignoras quoniam benignitas Dei ad poenitentiam te adducit?
verses.english: Or do you despise the riches of His goodness, and patience, and longsuffering? Do you not know that God’s goodness is meant to lead you to repentance?

verses.latin: Secundum autem duritiam tuam, et impoenitens cor, thesaurizas tibi iram in die irae, et revelationis justi judicii Dei,
verses.english: But according to your hardness and impenitent heart, you are storing up wrath for yourself in the day of wrath, when God’s righteous judgment is revealed.

verses.latin: qui reddet unicuique secundum opera ejus:
verses.english: He will render to each one according to his deeds.

verses.latin: iis quidem qui secundum patientiam boni operis, gloriam et honorem et incorruptionem quaerunt, vitam aeternam:
verses.english: To those who by patiently doing good works seek glory, honor, and immortality, He will give eternal life.

verses.latin: iis autem qui ex contentione et qui non obedientes sunt veritati, credentes autem iniquitati, ira et indignatio.
verses.english: But to those who are contentious and who do not obey the truth, but believe in wickedness, there will be wrath and indignation.

verses.latin: Tribulatio et angustia super omnem animam hominis operantis malum, Judaei primum, et Graeci.
verses.english: Tribulation and anguish will come upon every soul of man who does evil, first to the Jew and also to the Greek.

verses.latin: Gloria autem et honor et pax omni operanti bonum, Judaeo primum, et Graeco.
verses.english: But glory and honor and peace will be given to everyone who does good, first to the Jew and also to the Greek.

verses.latin: Non enim est personarum acceptio apud Deum.
verses.english: For there is no respect of persons with God.

verses.latin: Quicumque enim sine lege peccaverunt, sine lege peribunt: et quicumque in lege peccaverunt, per legem judicabuntur.
verses.english: For as many as have sinned without the Law will perish without the Law, and as many as have sinned in the Law will be judged by the Law.

verses.latin: Non enim auditores legis justi sunt apud Deum, sed factores legis justificabuntur.
verses.english: For it is not the hearers of the Law who are just in the sight of God, but the doers of the Law who will be justified.

verses.latin: Cum enim gentes, quae legem non habent, naturaliter ea, quae legis sunt, faciunt, hi, cum legem non habeant, ipsi sibi lex sunt:
verses.english: For when the Gentiles, who do not have the Law, do by nature the things that are in the Law, these, not having the Law, are a law unto themselves.

verses.latin: qui ostendunt opus legis scriptum in cordibus suis, testimonium perhibente illorum conscientia, et inter se invicem cogitationum accusantium, aut etiam excusantium.
verses.english: They show the work of the Law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts accusing or even excusing one another.

verses.latin: in die, quando judicabit Deus occulta hominum, secundum evangelium meum, per Jesum Christum.
verses.english: This will take place on the day when God will judge the secrets of men, according to my Gospel, through Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Si enim tu Judaeus cognominaris, et requiescis in lege, et gloriaris in Deo,
verses.english: Indeed, if you are called a Jew, and you rest in the Law, and you glory in God,

verses.latin: et nosti voluntatem ejus, et probas utiliora, instructus per legem,
verses.english: and you know His will, and you approve the things that are more important, being instructed by the Law,

verses.latin: confidis te ipsum ducem esse caecorum, lumen eorum qui in tenebris sunt,
verses.english: you trust that you yourself are a guide to the blind, a light to those in darkness,

verses.latin: eruditorem insipientium, magistrum parvulorum, habentem formam scientiae et veritatis in lege:
verses.english: a teacher of the foolish, a master of the young, possessing the form of knowledge and of truth in the Law.

verses.latin: qui ergo alium doces, te ipsum non doces? Qui praedicas non furandum, furaris?
verses.english: You, therefore, who teach another, do you not teach yourself? You who preach that one should not steal, do you steal?

verses.latin: Qui dicis non moechandum, moecharis? Qui abominaris idola, sacrilegium facis?
verses.english: You who say that one should not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you commit sacrilege?

verses.latin: Qui in lege gloriaris, per praevaricationem legis Deum inhonoras?
verses.english: You who glory in the Law, do you dishonor God by breaking the Law?

verses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: Propter vos nomen Dei blasphematur inter gentes.
verses.english: As it is written: “The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.”

verses.latin: Circumcisio quidem prodest, si legem facias: quod si praevaricator legis sis, circumcisio tua incircumcisio facta est.
verses.english: Circumcision indeed profits if you do the Law, but if you are a transgressor of the Law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.

verses.latin: Si igitur incircumcisus justificationes legis custodiat, nonne incircumcisio illius in circumcisionem reputabitur?
verses.english: If therefore the uncircumcised keep the just requirements of the Law, will not their uncircumcision be regarded as circumcision?

verses.latin: Et judicabit ea, quae ex natura sunt incircumcisa, legem expletura, te qui per litteram et circumcisionem praevaricator legis es.
verses.english: And that which is by nature uncircumcised, fulfilling the Law, will judge you who are a transgressor of the Law, though you have the letter and circumcision.

verses.latin: Non enim qui in manifesto Judaeus est, neque ea, quae in manifesto in carne, circumcisio:
verses.english: For it is not the one who is a Jew outwardly, nor is circumcision that which is outwardly in the flesh,

verses.latin: sed qui in abscondito Judaeus est: et circumcisio cordis in spiritu, non littera: cujus laus non ex hominibus, sed ex Deo est.
verses.english: but the one who is a Jew inwardly; and circumcision is of the heart, in the Spirit, not in the letter, whose praise is not from men but from God.

verses.latin: Quid ergo amplius habet Iudaeus, aut quae utilitas circumcisionis?
verses.english: So then, what advantage does a Jew have? What is the value of circumcision?

verses.latin: Multum per omnem modum. Primo quidem, quia credita sunt illis eloquia Dei.
verses.english: Much in every way! First, because the very words of God were entrusted to them.

verses.latin: Quid enim si quidam illorum increduli fuerunt? Numquid incredulitas illorum fidem Dei evacuabit?
verses.english: What if some of them were unfaithful? Does their unfaithfulness make God’s faithfulness of no effect?

verses.latin: Absit. Est autem Deus verax: omnis autem homo mendax, sicut scriptum est: Ut justificeris in sermonibus tuis, et vincas cum judicaris.
verses.english: Certainly not! Rather, God is true, but every man is a liar, as it is written: “That you may be justified in your words, and may overcome when you are judged.”

verses.latin: Si autem iniquitas nostra justitiam Dei commendat, quid dicemus? Numquid iniquus est Deus, qui iram infert?
verses.english: But if our wickedness commends the justice of God, what shall we say? Is God unjust, who inflicts wrath?

verses.latin: Secundum hominem dico. Absit. Alioquin quomodo judicabit Deus hunc mundum?
verses.english: I speak in a human way. Certainly not! Otherwise, how would God judge the world?

verses.latin: Nam si veritas Dei in meo mendacio abundavit in gloriam ipsius, quid adhuc et ego adhuc ut peccator judicor?
verses.english: For if the truth of God has increased through my lie to His glory, why am I still judged as a sinner?

verses.latin: Et sicut blasphemamur, et sicut quidam dicunt nos dicere: Faciamus mala ut veniant bona. Quorum damnatio justa est.
verses.english: And why not say, as we are blasphemously accused, and as some affirm that we say, “Let us do evil, that good may come”? Their condemnation is just.

verses.latin: Quid igitur? Praecellimus? Non. Nam praeostendimus quod tam Iudaei quam Graeci omnes sub peccato sunt,
verses.english: What then? Are we any better? Not at all. For we have previously charged that both Jews and Greeks are all under sin,

verses.latin: sicut scriptum est: Quia non est justus quisquam, non est qui intelligat, non est qui exquirat Deum.
verses.english: as it is written: “There is no one righteous, not even one; there is no one who understands; there is no one who seeks God.”

verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: “All have turned aside; together they have become useless; there is no one who does good, there is not even one.”

verses.latin: Sepulcrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant: venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum.
verses.english: “Their throat is an open tomb; with their tongues they have practiced deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips.”

verses.latin: Quorum os maledictione et amaritudine plenum est: veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem.
verses.english: “Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.” “Their feet are swift to shed blood,”

verses.latin: Contritio et infelicitas in viis eorum, et viam pacis non cognoverunt.
verses.english: “Ruin and misery are in their ways, and the way of peace they have not known.”

verses.latin: Non est timor Dei ante oculos eorum.
verses.english: “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”

verses.latin: Scimus autem quoniam quaecumque lex dicit, his qui in lege sunt, dicit: ut omne os obstruatur, et subditus fiat omnis mundus Deo.
verses.english: Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced, and all the world may become subject to God.

verses.latin: Quia ex operibus legis non justificabitur omnis caro coram illo. Per legem enim cognitio peccati.
verses.english: Therefore by the works of the law no flesh will be justified in His sight, because through the law comes the knowledge of sin.

verses.latin: Nunc autem sine lege justitia Dei manifestata est, testificata a lege et prophetis:
verses.english: But now the justice of God has been revealed apart from the law, being witnessed by the law and the prophets,

verses.latin: justitia autem Dei per fidem Jesu Christi in omnes et super omnes qui credunt: non enim est distinctio.
verses.english: the justice of God through faith in Jesus Christ, to all and upon all who believe. For there is no distinction,

verses.latin: omnes enim peccaverunt, et egent gloria Dei.
verses.english: for all have sinned and are deprived of the glory of God,

verses.latin: justificati gratis per gratiam ipsius, per redemptionem, quae est in Christo Jesu,
verses.english: and are justified freely by His grace through the redemption which is in Christ Jesus,

verses.latin: quem proposuit Deus propitiationem per fidem in sanguine ipsius, ad ostensionem justitiae suae propter remissionem praecedentium delictorum, in sustinentia Dei,
verses.english: whom God put forward as a propitiation by His blood, through faith, to demonstrate His justice, because in His divine forbearance He had passed over former sins,

verses.latin: in ostensionem justitiae ejus in hoc tempore: ut sit ipse justus, et justificans eum qui est ex fide Jesu.
verses.english: to demonstrate His justice at the present time, so that He might be just and the justifier of the one who has faith in Jesus.

verses.latin: Ubi est ergo gloriatio? Exclusa est. Per quam legem? Factorum? Non, sed per legem fidei.
verses.english: Then what becomes of boasting? It is excluded. By what law? Of works? No, but by the law of faith.

verses.latin: Arbitramur enim hominem justificari per fidem sine operibus legis.
verses.english: For we maintain that a man is justified by faith apart from works of the law.

verses.latin: An Judaeorum Deus tantum? nonne et gentium? Ita et gentium: quoniam quidem unus est Deus, qui justificat circumcisionem ex fide, et praeputium per fidem.
verses.english: Or is God the God of Jews only? Is He not the God of Gentiles also? Yes, of Gentiles also, since there is only one God, who will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through faith.

verses.latin: Legem ergo destruimus per fidem? Absit. Sed legem statuimus.
verses.english: Do we then nullify the law through faith? Certainly not! On the contrary, we uphold the law.

verses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus invenisse Abraham patrem nostrum secundum carnem?
verses.english: What then are we to say that Abraham, our forefather according to the flesh, discovered?

verses.latin: Si enim Abraham ex operibus justificatus est, habet gloriari, sed non apud Deum.
verses.english: If Abraham was justified by works, he would have something to boast about, but not before God.

verses.latin: Quid enim dicit Scriptura? Credidit Abraham Deo, et reputatum est illi ad justitiam.
verses.english: What does the Scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”

verses.latin: Ei autem qui operatur, merces non imputatur secundum gratiam, sed secundum debitum.
verses.english: Now to the one who works, wages are not credited as a favor, but as something owed.

verses.latin: Ei vero qui non operatur, credenti autem in eum qui justificat impium, reputatur fides ejus ad justitiam.
verses.english: But to the one who does not work, but believes in Him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is credited as righteousness.

verses.latin: Sicut et David dicit beatitudinem hominis, cui Deus accepto fert justitiam sine operibus:
verses.english: David also speaks of the blessedness of the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:

verses.latin: Beati quorum remissae sunt iniquitates, et quorum tecta sunt peccata.
verses.english: “Blessed are those whose transgressions are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.

verses.latin: Beatus vir cui non imputavit Dominus peccatum.
verses.english: Blessed is the man whose sin the Lord will not take into account.”

verses.latin: Beatitudo ergo haec in circumcisione tantum manet, an etiam in praeputio? Dicimus enim, reputata est Abrahae fides ad justitiam.
verses.english: Is this blessedness then only for the circumcised, or also for the uncircumcised? For we say that faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness.

verses.latin: Quomodo ergo reputata est? In circumcisione, an in praeputio? Non in circumcisione, sed in praeputio.
verses.english: How then was it credited? Was it after he had been circumcised, or before he was circumcised? It was not after he had been circumcised, but before.

verses.latin: Et signum accepit circumcisionis, signaculum justitiae fidei quae est in praeputio: ut sit pater omnium credentium per praeputium, ut reputetur et illis ad justitiam:
verses.english: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was still uncircumcised, that he might be the father of all those who believe, so that righteousness might be credited to them also.

verses.latin: et pater circumcisionis eorum qui non sunt ex circumcisione tantum, sed et qui sectantur vestigia fidei quae est in praeputio patris nostri Abrahae.
verses.english: And he is the father of the circumcised, who are not merely circumcised, but who also walk in the footsteps of the faith of our father Abraham which he had while still uncircumcised.

verses.latin: Non enim per legem promissio Abrahae, vel semini ejus, ut haeres esset mundi, sed per justitiam fidei.
verses.english: For the promise to Abraham and his descendants that he would be heir of the world was not through the Law, but through the righteousness of faith.

verses.latin: Si enim qui ex lege, hi haeredes sunt: exinanita est fides, abolita est promissio.
verses.english: For if those who are of the Law are heirs, then faith is made void, and the promise is nullified.

verses.latin: Lex enim iram operatur: nam ubi non est lex, nec praevaricatio.
verses.english: For the Law brings about wrath; but where there is no law, neither is there violation.

verses.latin: Ideo ex fide, ut secundum gratiam, ut firma sit promissio omni semini, non ei qui ex lege est tantum, sed et ei qui ex fide est Abrahae, qui pater est omnium nostrum,
verses.english: For this reason it is by faith, in order that it may be in accordance with grace, so that the promise will be guaranteed to all the descendants, not only to those who are of the Law, but also to those who are of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all,

verses.latin: (sicut scriptum est: Quia patrem multarum gentium posui te) ante Deum, cui credidit, qui vivificat mortuos, et vocat ea quae non sunt, tamquam ea quae sunt:
verses.english: (as it is written, “A father of many nations I have made you”) in the sight of Him whom he believed, even God, who gives life to the dead and calls into being that which does not exist.

verses.latin: qui contra spem in spem credidit, ut fieret pater multarum gentium, secundum quod dictum est: Sic erit semen tuum.
verses.english: In hope against hope he believed, so that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which had been spoken, “So shall your descendants be.”

verses.latin: Et non infirmatus fide, non consideravit mortuum corpus suum (cum jam fere centum annorum esset), neque mortuitatem vulvae Sarrae.
verses.english: Without becoming weak in faith he contemplated his own body, now as good as dead since he was about a hundred years old, and the deadness of Sarah’s womb;

verses.latin: in repromissionem Dei non haesitavit diffidentia, sed confortatus est fide, dans gloriam Deo:
verses.english: yet, with respect to the promise of God, he did not waver in unbelief but grew strong in faith, giving glory to God,

verses.latin: plenissime sciens, quia quaecumque promisit, potens est et facere.
verses.english: and being fully assured that what God had promised, He was able also to perform.

verses.latin: Ideo et reputatum est illi ad justitiam.
verses.english: Therefore it was also credited to him as righteousness.

verses.latin: Non est autem scriptum tantum propter ipsum, quia reputata est illi,
verses.english: Now not for his sake only was it written that it was credited to him,

verses.latin: sed et propter nos, quibus reputabitur credentibus in eum qui suscitavit Jesum Christum Dominum nostrum a mortuis,
verses.english: but for our sake also, to whom it will be credited, as those who believe in Him who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead,

verses.latin: qui traditus est propter delicta nostra, et resurrexit propter justificationem nostram.
verses.english: He who was delivered over because of our transgressions, and was raised because of our justification.

verses.latin: Iustificati igitur ex fide, pacem habemus ad Deum per Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum:
verses.english: Having been made righteous by faith, we now have peace with God through Our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: per quem et accessum habemus per fidem in gratiam istam, in qua stamus: et gloriamur in spe gloriae filiorum Dei.
verses.english: Through Him, we also have access by faith to this grace where we stand. And we also rejoice in the hope of the glory of the children of God.

verses.latin: Non solum autem, sed et gloriamur in tribulationibus: scientes quod tribulatio patientiam operatur,
verses.english: But not only this, we also rejoice in our sufferings, knowing that suffering produces endurance,

verses.latin: patientia vero probationem: probatio autem spem:
verses.english: and endurance produces proven character, and character, hope.

verses.latin: spes autem non confundit: quia caritas Dei diffusa est in cordibus nostris per Spiritum Sanctum qui datus est nobis.
verses.english: And hope does not disappoint, because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts by the Holy Spirit who has been given to us.

verses.latin: Utquid enim Christus, cum adhuc infirmi essemus, secundum tempus, pro impiis mortuus est?
verses.english: For while we were still weak, at the right time, Christ died for the ungodly.

verses.latin: Vix enim pro iusto quis moritur: nam pro bono forte quis et audet mori.
verses.english: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die; yet perhaps for a good man someone might dare to die.

verses.latin: Commedat autem Deus caritatem suam in nobis: quoniam, cum adhuc peccatores essemus, Christus pro nobis mortuus est.
verses.english: But God proves His love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.

verses.latin: Multo igitur magis nunc iustificati in sanguine ipsius, salvi erimus per ipsum a ira.
verses.english: Since therefore we have now been made righteous by His blood, we will be saved through Him from God's judgment.

verses.latin: Si enim, cum inimici essemus, reconciliati sumus Deo per mortem filii ejus: multo magis, reconciliati, salvi erimus in vita ipsius.
verses.english: For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of His Son, much more now that we are reconciled, we shall be saved by His life.

verses.latin: Non solum autem, sed et gloriamur in Deo per Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum: per quem nunc reconciliationem accepimus.
verses.english: Not only this, but we also rejoice in God through Our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received reconciliation.

verses.latin: Propterea sicut per unum hominem peccatum in hunc mundum intravit, et per peccatum mors, et ita in omnes homines mors pertransiit, in quo omnes peccaverunt.
verses.english: Therefore, just as through one man sin entered into the world, and through sin death, and thus death spread to all men, because all sinned.

verses.latin: Usque ad legem enim peccatum erat in mundo: peccatum autem non imputabatur, cum lex non esset.
verses.english: For sin was in the world before the law was given, but sin is not counted when there is no law.

verses.latin: Sed regnavit mors ab Adam usque ad Moysen etiam in eos qui non peccaverunt in similitudinem praevaricationis Adam, qui est figura ejus qui venturus erat.
verses.english: Nevertheless, death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over those who had not sinned in the likeness of Adam's transgression, who is a type of the One who was to come.

verses.latin: Sed non sicut delictum, ita et donum. Si enim unius delicto multi mortui sunt: multo magis gratia Dei, et donum in gratia unius hominis Iesu Christi, in plures abundavit.
verses.english: But the free gift is not like the trespass. For if by the trespass of the one man many died, how much more did the grace of God and the free gift by the grace of the one man Jesus Christ abound to the many!

verses.latin: Et non sicut per unum peccantem, ita et donum. Nam iudicium ex uno in condemnationem: gratia autem ex multis delictis in iustificationem.
verses.english: And the free gift is not like the result of that one man's sin. For the judgment following one trespass brought condemnation, but the free gift following many trespasses brought justification.

verses.latin: Si enim in unius delicto mors regnavit per unum: multo magis abundantiam gratiae, et donationis iustitiae, accipient qui abundantiam vitae per unum Iesum Christum.
verses.english: For if by the one man's trespass death reigned through that one, much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and the free gift of righteousness reign in life through the one Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Igitur sicut per unius delictum in omnes homines in condemnationem: ita et per unius iustitiam in omnes homines in iustificationem vitae.
verses.english: Therefore, as through one man's trespass there came condemnation for all men, so also through one righteous act there came justification for all men, resulting in life.

verses.latin: Sicut enim per inobedientiam unius hominis, peccatores constituti sunt multi: ita et per unius obeditionem, iusti constituentur multi.
verses.english: For as by one man's disobedience many were made sinners, so also by one man's obedience many will be made righteous.

verses.latin: Lex autem subintravit ut abundaret delictum. Ubi autem abundavit delictum, superabundavit gratia:
verses.english: Now the law came in to increase the trespass, but where sin increased, grace abounded all the more,

verses.latin: ut sicut regnavit peccatum in mortem: ita et gratia regnet per iustitiam in vitam aeternam per Iesum Christum Dominum nostrum.
verses.english: so that, as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness leading to eternal life through Our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus? Permanebimus in peccato, ut gratia abundet?
verses.english: So what should we say? Should we continue to sin, so that grace will increase?

verses.latin: Absit. Qui enim mortui sumus peccato, quomodo adhuc vivemus in illo?
verses.english: Absolutely not! If we are dead to sin, how can we continue to live in it?

verses.latin: An ignoratis quia quicumque baptizati sumus in Christo Iesu, in morte ipsius baptizati sumus?
verses.english: Don’t you know that all of us who were baptized in Christ Jesus were baptized in His death?

verses.latin: Consepulti enim sumus cum illo per baptismum in mortem: ut quomodo Christus surrexit a mortuis per gloriam Patris, ita et nos in novitate vitae ambulemus.
verses.english: Through baptism we were buried with Him in death, so that as Christ rose from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too might live a new life.

verses.latin: Si enim conplantati facti sumus similitudini mortis eius, simul et resurrectionis erimus:
verses.english: For if we have been united with Him in His death, we will certainly also be in His resurrection.

verses.latin: hoc scientes, quia vetus homo noster simul crucifisus est, ut destruatur corpus peccati, ut ultra non serviamus peccato.
verses.english: We know that our old self was crucified with Him so that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves to sin.

verses.latin: Qui enim mortuus est, justificatus est a peccato.
verses.english: Because someone who is dead has been freed from sin.

verses.latin: Si autem mortui sumus cum Christo, credimus quia simul etiam vivemus cum Christo:
verses.english: Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with Him.

verses.latin: scientes quod Christus resurgens ex mortuis iam non moritur: mors illi ultra non dominabitur.
verses.english: For we know that since Christ was raised from the dead, He cannot die again; death no longer has dominion over Him.

verses.latin: Quod enim mortuus est peccato, mortuus est semel: quod autem vivit, vivit Deo.
verses.english: The death that He died, He died to sin, once for all; but the life that He lives, He lives for God.

verses.latin: Ita et vos existimate vos mortuos quidem esse peccato, viventes autem Deo in Christo Iesu Domino nostro.
verses.english: So you also should consider yourselves dead to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.latin: Non ergo regnet peccatum in vestro mortali corpore, ad obedire concupiscentiis eius.
verses.english: Therefore, do not let sin reign in your mortal body, so that you obey its passions.

verses.latin: Sed neque exhibeatis membra vestra arma iniquitatis peccato: sed exhibete vos Deo, tamquam ex mortuis viventes: et membra vestra arma justitiae Deo.
verses.english: Do not offer any part of yourself to sin as an instrument of wickedness, but offer yourselves to God as those who have been brought from death to life, and offer your members to God as instruments of righteousness.

verses.latin: Peccatum enim vobis non dominabitur: non enim sub lege estis, sed sub gratia.
verses.english: For sin will no longer rule over you, because you are not under law, but under grace.

verses.latin: Quid igitur? Peccabimus, quoniam non sumus sub lege, sed sub gratia? Absit.
verses.english: So what? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace? Absolutely not!

verses.latin: Nescitis quoniam cui exhibetis vos servos ad obediendum, servi estis ejus cui obeditis: sive peccati ad mortem, sive obeditionis ad justitiam?
verses.english: Don’t you know that when you offer yourselves to someone to obey him as slaves, you are slaves of the one whom you obey—either of sin, which leads to death, or of obedience, which leads to righteousness?

verses.latin: Gratias autem Deo, quod fuistis servi peccati, sed obedistis ex corde in eam formam doctrinae, in qua traditi estis.
verses.english: But thanks be to God, that though you were slaves of sin, you have obeyed from the heart that pattern of teaching to which you were committed.

verses.latin: Liberati autem a peccato, servi facti estis justitiae.
verses.english: Having been set free from sin, you have become slaves of righteousness.

verses.latin: Humana dico propter imbecillitatem carnis vestrae: sicut enim exhibuistis membra vestra servire immunditiae et iniquitati ad iniquitatem, ita nunc exhibete membra vestra servire justitiae in sanctificationem.
verses.english: I am using an example from ordinary human life because of your weakness. For just as you presented your members as slaves of impurity and of lawlessness, leading to more lawlessness, so now present your members as slaves of righteousness, leading to sanctification.

verses.latin: Cum enim servi essetis peccati, liberi fuistis a justitia.
verses.english: When you were slaves of sin, you were free in regard to righteousness.

verses.latin: Quem fructum igitur habuistis tunc in iis, de quibus nunc pudet vos? Nam finis illorum mors est.
verses.english: But what fruit were you getting at that time from the things of which you are now ashamed? For the end of those things is death.

verses.latin: Nunc vero liberati a peccato, servi autem facti Deo, habetis fructum vestrum in sanctificationem, finem vero vitam aeternam.
verses.english: But now that you have been freed from sin and have become slaves of God, you have your fruit, leading to sanctification; the end is eternal life.

verses.latin: Nam stipendium peccati mors: gratia autem Dei, vita aeterna in Christo Iesu Domino nostro.
verses.english: For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.latin: Ignoratis, fratres (scio enim vobis scientibus legem), quoniam lex in homine dominatur quanto tempore vivit?
verses.english: Do you not know, brothers—I am speaking to those who know the law—that the law governs a man for as long as he lives?

verses.latin: Nam quae sub viro est mulier, vivente viro, alligata est legi: quod si mortuus fuerit vir ejus, soluta est a lege viri.
verses.english: For a woman who is married is bound by law to her husband as long as he lives; but if the husband dies, she is released from the law concerning the husband.

verses.latin: Igitur, vivente viro, vocabitur adultera si fuerit alteri viro: mortuo autem viro, libera est a lege, ut sit non adultera alteri viro.
verses.english: Accordingly, if she associates with another man while her husband is still alive, she will be called an adulteress; but if her husband dies, she is released from that law, so that she is not an adulteress when she marries another man.

verses.latin: Itaque, fratres mei, et vos mortificati estis legi per corpus Christi: ut sitis alterius, qui ex mortuis resurrexit, ut fructificemus Deo.
verses.english: Therefore, my brothers, you also have died to the law through the body of Christ, that you may belong to another, to him who has risen from the dead, in order that we may bear fruit for God.

verses.latin: Nam cum essemus in carne, passiones peccatorum, quae per legem erant, operabantur in membris nostris, ut fructificarent morti.
verses.english: For while we were in the flesh, the sinful passions, which were aroused by the law, were at work in our members to bear fruit for death.

verses.latin: Nunc autem soluti sumus a lege mortis, in qua detinebamur: ita ut serviamus in novitate spiritus, et non in vetustate litterae.
verses.english: But now we are released from the law, because we died to that which held us captive, so that we may serve in the newness of the Spirit and not in the oldness of the letter.

verses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus? Lexne peccatum est? Absit. Sed peccatum non cognovi nisi per legem. Nam concupiscentiam nesciebam, nisi lex diceret: Non concupisces.
verses.english: What then shall we say? Is the law sin? By no means! Yet, I did not come to know sin except through the law. For I would not have known what it is to covet if the law had not said, “You shall not covet.”

verses.latin: Occasione autem accepta, peccatum per mandatum operatum est in me omnem concupiscentiam. Sine enim lege, peccatum mortuum erat.
verses.english: But sin, seizing an opportunity through the commandment, produced in me every kind of covetousness. For apart from the law, sin was dead.

verses.latin: Ego autem vivebam sine lege aliquando: sed, facto mandato, peccatum revixit,
verses.english: I was once alive apart from the law, but when the commandment came, sin came alive,

verses.latin: ego autem mortuus sum. Et inventum est mihi mandatum, quod erat ad vitam, hoc esse ad mortem.
verses.english: and I died. And the very commandment that promised life proved to be death to me.

verses.latin: Peccatum enim, occasione accepta per mandatum, seduxit me, et per illud occidit.
verses.english: For sin, seizing an opportunity through the commandment, deceived me and by it killed me.

verses.latin: Itaque lex quidem sancta, et mandatum sanctum, et justum, et bonum.
verses.english: So the law is holy, and the commandment is holy and righteous and good.

verses.latin: Quod ergo bonum est, mihi factum est mors? Absit. Sed peccatum, ut appareat peccatum, per bonum operatum est mihi mortem: ut fiat supra modum peccatum peccans per mandatum.
verses.english: Did that which is good, then, become death to me? By no means! It was sin, producing death in me through what is good, in order that sin might be shown to be sin, and through the commandment might become sinful beyond measure.

verses.latin: Scimus enim quod lex spiritalis est: ego autem carnalis sum, venundatus sub peccatum.
verses.english: For we know that the law is spiritual, but I am of the flesh, sold under sin.

verses.latin: Quod enim operor, non intelligo: non enim quod volo, hoc ago; sed quod odi, illud facio.
verses.english: For I do not understand my own actions. For I do not do what I want, but I do the very thing I hate.

verses.latin: Si autem quod nolo, hoc facio, consentio legi quoniam bona est.
verses.english: Now if I do what I do not want, I agree with the law, that it is good.

verses.latin: Nunc autem jam non ego operor illud, sed quod habitat in me peccatum.
verses.english: So now it is no longer I who do it, but sin that dwells within me.

verses.latin: Scio enim quia non habitat in me, hoc est, in carne mea, bonum. Nam velle adjacet mihi: perficere autem bonum, non invenio.
verses.english: For I know that nothing good dwells in me, that is, in my flesh. For I have the desire to do what is right, but not the ability to carry it out.

verses.latin: Non enim quod volo bonum, hoc facio; sed quod nolo malum, hoc ago.
verses.english: For I do not do the good I want, but the evil I do not want is what I keep on doing.

verses.latin: Si autem quod nolo, hoc facio: jam non ego operor illud, sed quod habitat in me peccatum.
verses.english: Now if I do what I do not want, it is no longer I who do it, but sin that dwells within me.

verses.latin: Invenio igitur legem, volenti mihi facere bonum, quoniam mihi malum adjacet.
verses.english: So I find it to be a law that when I want to do right, evil lies close at hand.

verses.latin: Delector enim in lege Dei secundum interiorem hominem:
verses.english: For I delight in the law of God, in my inner being,

verses.latin: video autem aliam legem in membris meis repugnantem legi mentis meae, et captivantem me in lege peccati, quae est in membris meis.
verses.english: but I see in my members another law waging war against the law of my mind and making me captive to the law of sin that dwells in my members.

verses.latin: Infelix ego homo! quis me liberabit de corpore mortis hujus?
verses.english: Wretched man that I am! Who will deliver me from this body of death?

verses.latin: Gratia Dei per Jesum Christum Dominum nostrum. Igitur ego ipse mente servio legi Dei, carne autem legi peccati.
verses.english: Thanks be to God through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, I myself serve the law of God with my mind, but with my flesh I serve the law of sin.

verses.latin: Nihil ergo est nunc damnationis iis, qui sunt in Christo Iesu, qui non secundum carnem ambulant, sed secundum spiritum.
verses.english: There is, therefore, no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus, who do not live according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

verses.latin: Lex enim spiritus vitae in Christo Iesu liberavit me a lege peccati et mortis.
verses.english: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and death.

verses.latin: Nam quod inpossibile erat legi, quod infirmatur per carnem: Deus Filium suum mittens in similitudinem carnis peccati, et de peccato damnavit peccatum in carne,
verses.english: For what the Law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God did: sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, he condemned sin in the flesh,

verses.latin: ut iustificatio legis impleretur in nobis, qui non secundum carnem ambulamus, sed secundum spiritum.
verses.english: that the righteousness of the Law might be fulfilled in us, who do not walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

verses.latin: Qui enim secundum carnem sunt, quae carnis sunt, sapiunt: qui vero secundum spiritum, quae sunt spiritus.
verses.english: For those who are according to the flesh, mind the things of the flesh; but those who are according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit.

verses.latin: Nam sapere carnis, mors: sapere autem spiritus, vita et pax.
verses.english: For the mind of the flesh is death; but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace.

verses.latin: Quoniam sapientia carnis inimicitia est ad Deum: legi enim Dei non est subiecta, nec enim potest.
verses.english: Because the mind of the flesh is enmity against God; for it is not subject to the law of God, neither can it be.

verses.latin: Qui autem in carne sunt, Deo placere non possunt.
verses.english: And those who are in the flesh cannot please God.

verses.latin: Vos autem in carne non estis, sed in spiritu: si tamen Spiritus Dei habitat in vobis. Si quis autem Spiritum Christi non habet, hic non est eius.
verses.english: But you are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if the Spirit of God dwells in you. Now if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he is not His.

verses.latin: Si autem Christus in vobis est: corpus quidem mortuum est propter peccatum, spiritus vero vita propter iustitiam.
verses.english: And if Christ is in you, the body indeed is dead because of sin; but the Spirit is life because of righteousness.

verses.latin: Quod si Spiritus eius, qui suscitavit Iesum a mortuis, habitat in vobis: qui suscitavit Iesum a mortuis, vivificabit et mortalia corpora vestra propter inhabitantem Spiritum eius in vobis.
verses.english: And if the Spirit of Him Who raised up Jesus from the dead dwells in you, He Who raised up Christ Jesus from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies because of His Spirit who dwells in you.

verses.latin: Ergo, fratres, debitores sumus non carni, ut secundum carnem vivamus.
verses.english: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live according to the flesh.

verses.latin: Si enim secundum carnem vixeritis, moriemini: si autem spiritu facta carnis mortificaveritis, vivetis.
verses.english: For if you live according to the flesh, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the flesh, you will live.

verses.latin: Quicumque enim Spiritu Dei aguntur, hi filii Dei sunt.
verses.english: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.

verses.latin: Non enim accepistis spiritum servitutis iterum in timorem, sed accepistis spiritum adoptionis filiorum, in quo clamamus: Abba (Pater).
verses.english: For you have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but you have received the Spirit of adoption, by which we cry out: Abba (Father).

verses.latin: Ipse enim Spiritus testimonium reddit spiritui nostro, quod sumus filii Dei.
verses.english: For the Spirit Himself bears witness with our spirit that we are the children of God.

verses.latin: Si autem filii, et heredes: heredes quidem Dei, coheredes autem Christi: si tamen compatimur, ut et conglorificemur.
verses.english: And if children, then heirs also; heirs indeed of God, and joint heirs with Christ: yet so if we suffer with Him, that we may also be glorified with Him.

verses.latin: Existimo enim quod non sunt condignae passiones huius temporis ad futuram gloriam, quae revelabitur in nobis.
verses.english: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory to come, that shall be revealed in us.

verses.latin: Nam exspectatio creaturae revelationem filiorum Dei exspectat.
verses.english: For the earnest expectation of the creature waits for the revelation of the sons of God.

verses.latin: Vanitati enim creatura subiecta est, non volens, sed propter eum qui subiecit eam in spem:
verses.english: For the creature was made subject to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who has subjected the same in hope:

verses.latin: quoniam et ipsa creatura liberabitur a servitute corruptionis in libertatem gloriae filiorum Dei.
verses.english: because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the servitude of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the sons of God.

verses.latin: Scimus enim quod omnis creatura congemiscit et contristatur usque adhuc.
verses.english: For we know that every creature groans and is in pain until now.

verses.latin: Non solum autem, sed et ipsi primitias spiritus habentes, et ipsi ingemiscimus intra nos, adoptionem filiorum exspectantes, redemptionem corporis nostri.
verses.english: And not only they, but ourselves also, who have the first fruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption of the sons of God, the redemption of our body.

verses.latin: Spe enim salvi facti sumus. Spes autem quae videtur, non est spes: nam quod videt quis, quid sperat?
verses.english: For we are saved by hope. But hope that is seen is not hope; for what a man sees, why does he hope for?

verses.latin: Si autem quod non videmus, speramus: per patientiam exspectamus.
verses.english: But if we hope for that which we do not see, we wait for it with patience.

verses.latin: Similiter autem et Spiritus iuvat infirmitatem nostram: nam quid oremus sicut oportet, nescimus: sed ipse Spiritus postulat pro nobis gemitibus inenarrabilibus.
verses.english: Likewise the Spirit also helps our infirmity. For we do not know what we should pray for as we ought; but the Spirit Himself asks for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.

verses.latin: Qui autem scrutatur corda, scit quid desideret Spiritus: quia secundum Deum postulat pro sanctis.
verses.english: And He Who searches the hearts knows what the Spirit desires; because He asks for the saints according to God.

verses.latin: Scimus autem quoniam diligentibus Deum omnia cooperantur in bonum, his qui secundum propositum vocati sunt sancti.
verses.english: And we know that to them that love God, all things work together unto good, to such as, according to his purpose, are called to be saints.

verses.latin: Nam quos praescivit, et praedestinavit conformes fieri imaginis Filii eius: ut sit ipse primogenitus in multis fratribus.
verses.english: For those whom he foreknew, he also predestined to be made conformable to the image of His Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.

verses.latin: Quos autem praedestinavit, hos et vocavit: et quos vocavit, hos et iustificavit: quos autem iustificavit, hos et glorificavit.
verses.english: And whom he predestined, them he also called; and whom he called, them he also justified; and whom he justified, them he also glorified.

verses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus ad haec? Si Deus pro nobis, quis contra nos?
verses.english: What shall we then say to these things? If God is for us, who is against us?

verses.latin: Qui etiam proprio Filio suo non pepercit, sed pro nobis omnibus tradidit illum: quomodo non etiam cum illo omnia nobis donavit?
verses.english: He that spared not even His own Son, but delivered Him up for us all, how has He not also, with Him, given us all things?

verses.latin: Quis intulit accusatio adversus electos Dei? Deus qui iustificat.
verses.english: Who shall bring a charge against the elect of God? It is God Who justifies.

verses.latin: Quis est qui condemnet? Christus Iesus, qui mortuus est, immo qui et resurrexit, qui est ad dexteram Dei, qui etiam interpellat pro nobis.
verses.english: Who is he that shall condemn? It is Christ Jesus Who has died, yes, Who is risen again, Who is at the right hand of God, Who also makes intercession for us.

verses.latin: Quis nos separabit a caritate Christi? Tribulatio? an angustia? an persecutio? an fames? an nuditas? an periculum? an gladius?
verses.english: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation? or distress? or persecution? or famine? or nakedness? or peril? or the sword?

verses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: Quia propter te mortificamur tota die: aestimati sumus ut oves occisionis.
verses.english: As it is written: For Your sake we are put to death all the day long: we are regarded as sheep for the slaughter.

verses.latin: Sed in his omnibus superamus per eum qui dilexit nos.
verses.english: But in all these things, we overcome, because of Him Who loved us.

verses.latin: Certus sum enim quia neque mors, neque vita, neque angeli, neque principatus, neque virtutes, neque instantia, neque futura, neque fortitudo,
verses.english: For I am persuaded that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come, nor might,

verses.latin: neque altitudo, neque profundum, neque creatura alia poterit nos separare a caritate Dei, quae est in Christo Iesu Domino nostro.
verses.english: nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.latin: Veritatem dico in Christo, non mentior, testimonium mihi perhibente conscientia mea in Spiritu Sancto,
verses.english: I speak the truth in Christ, I do not lie, because my conscience confirms it in the Holy Spirit,

verses.latin: quoniam tristitia mihi magna est, et continuus dolor cordi meo.
verses.english: because I feel great sadness, and constant grief in my heart.

verses.latin: Optabam enim ego ipse anathema esse a Christo pro fratribus meis, qui sunt cognati mei secundum carnem:
verses.english: I pray that I myself could be cursed and cut off from Christ for the sake of my brothers, my own flesh and blood, the Jews:

verses.latin: qui sunt Israëlitæ, quorum ad filios adoptio, et gloria, et testamenta, et legislatio, et obsequium, et promissiones:
verses.english: who are Israelites; to them belong the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the Law, the worship, and the promises:

verses.latin: quorum patres, et ex quibus Christus secundum carnem: qui est super omnia Deus benedictus in sæcula. Amen.
verses.english: to them belong the patriarchs, and from them, according to the flesh, came Christ. May God, Who is over all, be blessed forever. Amen.

verses.latin: Non autem potest verbum Dei evacuari. Nam non omnes qui ex Israël sunt, hii sunt Israëlitæ:
verses.english: But it is not as though the word of God has failed. For not all who are from Israel are truly Israel,

verses.latin: neque quia semen sunt Abrahæ, idcirco omnes filii, sed in Isaac vocabitur tibi semen.
verses.english: and not all of Abraham’s descendants are his children, but “through Isaac shall your descendants be named.”

verses.latin: Id est, non qui filii carnis, hi filii Dei: sed qui filii sunt promissionis, aestimantur in semen.
verses.english: This means that it is not the children of the flesh who are the children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as descendants.

verses.latin: Promissionis enim verbum hoc est: Secundum hoc tempus veniam, et erit Isæc filius Saræ.
verses.english: For the word of promise was this: “About this time I will return, and Sarah will have a son.”

verses.latin: Sed et Rebecca ex uno concubitu habens, ex Isaac patre nostro.
verses.english: And not only that, but also Rebecca, when she had conceived children by one husband, our father Isaac,

verses.latin: (cum enim nondum nati fuissent, aut aliquid egissent bonum aut malum) ut secundum propositum Dei, secundum electionem, maneret,
verses.english: (though they were not yet born and had not done anything good or bad) so that God’s purpose of election might continue,

verses.latin: non ex operibus, sed ex vocante, dictum est ei, Quia major serviet minori.
verses.english: not because of works but because of the One who calls, she was told, “The older will serve the younger.”

verses.latin: Sicut scriptum est: Jacob dilexi, Esau autem odio habui.
verses.english: As it is written, “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”

verses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus? Numquid iniquitas est apud Deum? Absit.
verses.english: What shall we say then? Is there injustice with God? Certainly not.

verses.latin: Mosi enim dicit: Miserebor cuius misereor, et misericordiam præbebo cuius misericordiam mihi.
verses.english: For He says to Moses, “I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”

verses.latin: Igitur non est volentis, neque currentis, sed miserentis Dei.
verses.english: So then it depends not on human will or exertion, but on God, Who has mercy.

verses.latin: Dicit enim Scriptura Pharaoni: In hoc ipsum excitavi te, ut ostendam in te virtutem meam, et ut annuntietur nomen meum in universa terra.
verses.english: For the Scripture says to Pharaoh, “For this very purpose I have raised you up, that I might show My power in you, and that My name may be proclaimed in all the earth.”

verses.latin: Ergo cui vult miseretur, et quem vult indurat.
verses.english: So then He has mercy on whomever He wills, and He hardens whomever He wills.

verses.latin: Dices ergo mihi: Quid adhuc queritur? voluntati enim eius quis resistit?
verses.english: You will say to me then, “Why does He still find fault? For who can resist His will?”

verses.latin: O homo, tu quis es, qui respondeas Deo? Numquid dicit figmentum ei qui se finxit: Quid me fecisti sic?
verses.english: But who are you, O man, to answer back to God? Will what is molded say to its molder, “Why have you made me like this?”

verses.latin: Aut non habet potestatem figulus lutum ex eadem massa, facere aliud quidem vas in honorem, aliud vero in contumeliam?
verses.english: Does not the potter have power over the clay, to make from the same lump one vessel for honorable use and another for dishonorable use?

verses.latin: Quod si volens Deus ostendere iram suam, et notam facere potentiam suam, sustinuit in multâ patientiâ vasa iræ, apta in interitum,
verses.english: What if God, desiring to show His wrath and to make known His power, has endured with much patience vessels of wrath made for destruction,

verses.latin: ut ostenderet divitias gloriæ suæ in vasa misericordiæ, quæ præparavit in gloriam?
verses.english: in order to make known the riches of His glory for vessels of mercy, which He has prepared beforehand for glory—

verses.latin: Quos et vocavit nos non solum ex Judæis, sed etiam ex gentibus,
verses.english: even us whom He has called, not from the Jews only but also from the Gentiles?

verses.latin: Sicut in Osee dicit: Vocabo non plebem meam, plebem meam: et non dilectam, dilectam.
verses.english: As indeed He says in Hosea, “Those who were not My people I will call ‘My people,’ and she who was not beloved I will call ‘beloved.’”

verses.latin: Et erit: In loco ubi dictum est eis: Non plebs mea vos: ibi vocabuntur filii Dei vivi.
verses.english: “And in the very place where it was said to them, ‘You are not My people,’ there they will be called sons of the living God.”

verses.latin: Isaias autem clamat pro Israël: Si fuerit numerus filiorum Israël sicut harena maris, reliquiæ salvæ fient.
verses.english: And Isaiah cries out concerning Israel: “Though the number of the sons of Israel be as the sand of the sea, only the remnant of them will be saved,

verses.latin: verbum enim brevians faciet Dominus super terram.
verses.english: for the Lord will execute His sentence upon the earth in righteousness and quickly.”

verses.latin: Et sicut prædixit Isaias: Nisi Dominus Sabaoth reliquisset nobis semen, sicut Sodoma facti essemus, et sicut Gomorrha similes fuissemus.
verses.english: And as Isaiah predicted, “Unless the Lord of hosts had left us offspring, we would have become like Sodom and been made like Gomorrah.”

verses.latin: Quid ergo dicemus? Quod gentes, quæ non sectabantur justitiam, apprehenderunt justitiam: justitiam autem, quæ ex fide est:
verses.english: What shall we say then? That Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have attained it, that is, righteousness through faith,

verses.latin: Israël vero sectans legem justitiæ, in legem justitiæ non pervenit.
verses.english: but that Israel, who pursued the law of righteousness, did not attain that law.

verses.latin: Quare? Quia non ex fide, sed quasi ex operibus: potuerunt enim in lapidem offensionis.
verses.english: Why? Because they did not pursue it by faith, but as though it were by works. They have stumbled over the stumbling stone,

verses.latin: sicut scriptum est: Ecce pono in Sion lapidem offensionis, et petram scandali: et omnis qui credit in eum, non confundetur.
verses.english: as it is written, “Behold, I am laying in Zion a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offense; and everyone who believes in Him will not be put to shame.”

verses.latin: Fratres, bonam quidem voluntatem habens pro illis, et obsecro pro Israel ad Deum.
verses.english: Brothers and sisters, I have a heartfelt desire for the salvation of those in Israel, and I pray to God for them.

verses.latin: Testimonium enim perhibeo illis quod æmulationem Dei habent, sed non secundum scientiam.
verses.english: For I can testify about them that they have zeal for God, but not according to the knowledge of God.

verses.latin: Ignorantes enim justitiam Dei, et suam quærentes statuere, justitiæ Dei non sunt subjecti.
verses.english: For they do not understand the righteousness of God, and they want to establish their own, and so they are not obedient to the righteousness of God.

verses.latin: Finis enim legis Christus, ad justitiam omni credenti.
verses.english: For Christ is the fulfillment of the Law, bringing righteousness to everyone who believes.

verses.latin: Moses enim scribit justitiam, quæ ex lege est: Quia justitiam, quæ facit homo, vivet in ea.
verses.english: For Moses writes about the righteousness that comes from the Law: “The person who does these things will live by them.”

verses.latin: Quæ autem ex fide est, justitia, sic dicit: Ne dixeris in corde tuo: Quis ascendet in cælum? hoc est, Christum deducere.
verses.english: But the righteousness that comes from faith says: “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into the universe?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ down).

verses.latin: Aut: Quis descendet in abyssum? hoc est, Christum a mortuis revocare.
verses.english: “Or, ‘Who will descend into the abyss?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).

verses.latin: Sed quid dicit? Prope est verbum in ore tuo, et in corde tuo: hoc est verbum fidei, quod prædicamus.
verses.english: But what does it say? “The Son is near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart,” (that is, the word of faith that we preach).

verses.latin: Quia si confitearis in ore tuo Dominum Jesum, et in corde tuo credideris quod Deus illum suscitavit a mortuis, salvus eris.
verses.english: Because, if you declare with your mouth that Jesus is Lord, and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

verses.latin: Corde enim creditur ad justitiam, ore autem confessio fit ad salutem.
verses.english: For with the heart one believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.

verses.latin: Dicit enim Scriptura: Omnis qui credit in illum, non confundetur.
verses.english: For the Scripture says, “Everyone who believes in him will not be put to shame.”

verses.latin: Non enim est distinctio Judæi et Græci: nam idem Dominus omnium, dives in omnes qui invocant illum.
verses.english: For there is no difference between Jew and Greek: for the same Lord is Lord of all, rich unto all who call upon Him.

verses.latin: Omnis enim quicumque invocaverit nomen Domini, salvus erit.
verses.english: For whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.

verses.latin: Quomodo ergo invocabunt, in quem non crediderunt? aut quomodo credent ei quem non audierunt? quomodo autem audient sine prædicante?
verses.english: How, then, can they call on Him whom they have not believed? And how are they to believe in Him of whom they have not heard? And how are they to hear without someone preaching?

verses.latin: Quomodo autem prædicabunt nisi missi fuerint? sicut scriptum est: Quam speciosi pedes evangelizantium pacem, evangelizantium bona!
verses.english: And how are they to preach unless they are sent on a mission by God? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace, who bring good news!”

verses.latin: Sed non omnes obediunt evangelio. Isaias enim dicit: Domine, quis credidit auditui nostro?
verses.english: But not all have obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says, “Lord, who has believed our report?”

verses.latin: Ergo fides ex auditu, auditus autem per verbum Christi.
verses.english: So faith comes from hearing, and hearing through the word of Christ.

verses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid non audierunt? Et quidem in omnem terram exivit sonus eorum, et in fines orbis terræ verba eorum.
verses.english: But I ask: Did they not hear? Yes, truly, their sound went out to all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.

verses.latin: Sed dico: Numquid Israel non cognovit? Primus Moyses dicit: Ego ad æmulationem vos adducam in gentem non gentem, in gentem insipientem provocabo vos.
verses.english: But I ask: Did Israel not know? First Moses says, “I will make you jealous of those who are not a nation; with a foolish nation I will provoke you.”

verses.latin: Isaias autem audet, et dicit: Inventus sum a non quærentibus me, palam apparui eis qui me non quærebant.
verses.english: Then Isaiah is so bold as to say, “I was found by those who did not seek me; I revealed myself to those who did not ask for me.”

verses.latin: Ad Israel autem dicit: Tota die extendi manus meas ad populum non credentem, et contradicentem.
verses.english: But to Israel he says, “All day long I have held out my hands to a disobedient and contrary people.”

verses.latin: Dico ergo : Numquid repulit Deus plebem suam ? Absit. Nam et ego Israelita sum, ex semine Abraham, de tribu Beniamin.
verses.english: So here’s what I mean: Did God reject His people? Absolutely not! I, too, am an Israelite, a descendant of Abraham, from the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Non repulit Deus plebem suam, quam praescivit. An nescitis in Elia quid dicit Scriptura ? Quomodo interpellat Deum adversum Israël, dicens :
verses.english: God didn't reject His people, whom He knew ahead of time. Don't you know what Scripture says about Elijah? He pleaded with God against Israel, saying:

verses.latin: Domine, prophetas tuos occiderunt, altaria tua suffoderunt ; et ego relictus sum solus, et quaerunt animam meam.
verses.english: “Lord, they have killed your prophets, they have torn down your altars, and I alone am left, and they seek my life.”

verses.latin: Sed quid dicit illi divinum responsum ? Reliqui mihi septem millia virorum, qui non curvaverunt genua ante Baal.
verses.english: But what was the divine answer to him? “I have kept for myself seven thousand men who have not bent the knee to Baal.”

verses.latin: Ita ergo et in hoc tempore reliquiae secundum electionem gratiae salvatae sunt.
verses.english: So, in the same way, at the present time there is a remnant, a remnant who were saved by the grace of God.

verses.latin: Si autem ex gratia, jam non ex operibus : alioquin gratia jam non est gratia.
verses.english: Now, if it is by grace, then it is no longer by works; otherwise, grace would no longer be grace.

verses.latin: Quid ergo ? Quod quaerebat Israël, hoc non est consecutus ; electi autem consecuti sunt : ceteri vero excaecati sunt.
verses.english: What then? What Israel was seeking, it has not obtained, but the elect have obtained it; the rest were blinded.

verses.latin: (Sicut scriptum est : Dedit illis Deus spiritum compunctionis ; oculos ut non videant, et aures ut non audiant usque in hodiernum diem.)
verses.english: (As it is written: “God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that would not see and ears that would not hear, down to this very day.”)

verses.latin: Et David dicit : Fiat mensa eorum in conspectu eorum in laqueum, et in captionem, et in scandalum, et in retributionem illis.
verses.english: And David says: “Let their table become a snare before them, a trap, a stumbling block, and a retribution for them.

verses.latin: Obscurentur oculi eorum ne videant : et dorsum eorum incurva semper.
verses.english: Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see, and their backs bowed down always.”

verses.latin: Dico ergo : Numquid sic impulerunt ut caderent ? Absit. Sed illorum delicto salus gentibus, ut illos aemulentur.
verses.english: So I ask: Did they stumble so as to fall beyond recovery? Absolutely not! But because of their transgression, salvation has come to the Gentiles, to make Israel envious.

verses.latin: Quod si delictum eorum divitiae sunt mundi, et diminutio eorum divitiae gentium : quanto magis plenitudo eorum ?
verses.english: Now if their transgression means riches for the world, and their failure means riches for the Gentiles, how much more will their fullness bring?

verses.latin: Vobis enim dico gentibus : Quatenus quidem ego sum gentium apostolus, ministerium meum honorifico,
verses.english: Now I am speaking to you Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am an apostle to the Gentiles, I magnify my ministry,

verses.latin: si quo modo aemulabor meam carnem, et salvos faciam ex illis aliquos.
verses.english: in the hope that I may provoke my own flesh to envy and save some of them.

verses.latin: Si enim jactura eorum reconciliatio est mundi : quae assumptio, nisi vita ex mortuis ?
verses.english: For if their rejection means the reconciliation of the world, what will their acceptance mean but life from the dead?

verses.latin: Quod si primitiae sanctae, et massa : et si radix sancta, et rami.
verses.english: If the first fruits are holy, so is the whole batch; and if the root is holy, so are the branches.

verses.latin: Quod si quidam ex ramis fracti sunt, tu autem oleaster insertus es in illos, et socius radicis et pinguedinis olivae :
verses.english: But if some of the branches were broken off, and you, a wild olive shoot, were grafted in among the others and now share in the nourishing root of the olive tree,

verses.latin: noli gloriari adversum ramos : quod si gloriaris, non tu radicem portas, sed radix te.
verses.english: do not boast over the branches. If you do boast, remember that you do not support the root, but the root supports you.

verses.latin: Dices ergo : Fracti sunt rami, ut ego inserar.
verses.english: Then you will say, “Branches were broken off so that I might be grafted in.”

verses.latin: Bene : propter incredulitatem fracti sunt. Tu autem fide stas : noli altum sapere, sed time.
verses.english: That is true. They were broken off because of their unbelief, but you stand fast through faith. So do not be arrogant, but fear.

verses.latin: Si enim Deus naturalibus ramis non pepercit : ne forte nec tibi parcat.
verses.english: For if God did not spare the natural branches, perhaps He will not spare you either.

verses.latin: Vide ergo bonitatem et severitatem Dei : in eos quidem qui ceciderunt, severitatem ; in te autem bonitatem Dei, si permanseris in bonitate : alioquin et tu excideris.
verses.english: See then the kindness and severity of God: severity toward those who fell, but God's kindness toward you, provided you continue in His kindness. Otherwise, you too will be cut off.

verses.latin: Sed et illi, si non permanserint in incredulitate, inserentur : potens est enim Deus iterum illos inserere.
verses.english: And even they, if they do not continue in their unbelief, will be grafted in, for God is able to graft them in again.

verses.latin: Nam si tu ex naturali oleastro sectus es, et contra naturam insertus es in olivam bonam : quanto magis isti, qui secundum naturam sunt, inserentur suae olivae ?
verses.english: For if you were cut from what is by nature a wild olive tree, and grafted, contrary to nature, into a cultivated olive tree, how much more will these, the natural branches, be grafted back into their own olive tree?

verses.latin: Nolo enim vos ignorare, fratres, hanc mysterium, ut non sitis vobis ipsis sapientes : quia caecitas ex parte contigit in Israël, donec plenitudo gentium intraret,
verses.english: I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery, brothers and sisters, so that you will not be conceited: A partial hardening has come upon Israel until the full number of the Gentiles has come in.

verses.latin: et sic omnis Israël salvus erit, sicut scriptum est : Veniet ex Sion qui eripiat, et avertet impietatem a Jacob.
verses.english: And in this way all Israel will be saved, as it is written: “The Deliverer will come from Zion; He will banish ungodliness from Jacob.”

verses.latin: Et hoc illis testamentum meum, cum abstulero peccata eorum.
verses.english: “And this will be My covenant with them when I take away their sins.”

verses.latin: Secundum Evangelium quidem, inimici propter vos : secundum electionem autem, carissimi propter patres.
verses.english: As regards the gospel, they are enemies for your sake; but as regards election, they are beloved for the sake of their forefathers.

verses.latin: Sine poenitentia enim sunt dona et vocatio Dei.
verses.english: For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable.

verses.latin: Sicut enim vos aliquando non credidistis Deo, nunc autem misericordiam consecuti estis propter illorum incredulitatem :
verses.english: For just as you disobeyed God in the past but have now received mercy because of their disobedience,

verses.latin: ita et isti nunc non crediderunt in vestram misericordiam, ut et ipsi misericordiam consequantur.
verses.english: so they too have now disobeyed, so that by the mercy shown to you, they also may now receive mercy.

verses.latin: Conclusit enim Deus omnia in incredulitatem, ut omnium misereatur.
verses.english: For God has consigned all to disobedience, that He may have mercy on all.

verses.latin: O altitudo divitiarum sapientiæ et scientiæ Dei ! Quam incomprehensibilia judicia ejus, et investigabiles viae ejus !
verses.english: Oh, the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are His judgments and unfathomable His ways!

verses.latin: Quis enim cognovit sensum Domini ? Aut quis consiliarius ejus fuit ?
verses.english: “For who has known the mind of the Lord, or who has been His counselor?”

verses.latin: Aut quis prior dedit illi, et retribuetur ei ?
verses.english: “Or who has first given to Him, that He should be repaid?”

verses.latin: Quoniam ex ipso, et per ipsum, et in ipso sunt omnia : ipsi gloria in sæcula sæculorum. Amen.
verses.english: For from Him and through Him and to Him are all things. To Him be glory forever. Amen.

verses.latin: Obsecro itaque vos, fratres, per misericordiam Dei, ut exhibeatis corpora vestra hostiam viventem, sanctam, Deo placentem, rationabile obsequium vestrum.
verses.english: Therefore, brothers, I implore you by God's compassion: offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy, pleasing to God. This is your true worship.

verses.latin: Et nolite conformari huic saeculo: sed reformamini in novitate sensus vestri: ut probetis quae sit voluntas Dei, bona, et beneplacens, et perfecta.
verses.english: Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind. Then you will be able to discern the will of God—what is good, pleasing, and perfect.

verses.latin: Dico enim per gratiam, quae data est mihi, omnibus qui sunt inter vos, non plus sapere quam oportet sapere, sed sapere ad sobrietatem, unicuique sicut Deus partitus est mensuram fidei.
verses.english: For by the grace given to me, I say to everyone among you not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think with sober judgment, each according to the measure of faith which God has assigned.

verses.latin: Sicut enim in uno corpore multa membra habemus: omnia autem membra non eundem actum habent:
verses.english: For as in one body we have many members, and the members do not all have the same function,

verses.latin: ita multi unum corpus sumus in Christo, singuli autem alter alterius membra.
verses.english: so we, though many, are one body in Christ, and individually members one of another.

verses.latin: Habentes autem dona differentia secundum gratiam, quae data est nobis, sive prophetiam secundum rationem fidei,
verses.english: Having gifts that differ according to the grace given to us, let us use them: if prophecy, in proportion to our faith;

verses.latin: sive ministerium, in ministrando: sive qui docet, in doctrina:
verses.english: if service, in service; the one who teaches, in teaching;
