verses.latin: qui exhortatur, in exhortando: qui tribuit, in simplicitate: qui praeest, in sollicitudine: qui miseretur, in hilaritate.
verses.english: the one who exhorts, in his exhortation; the one who contributes, in generosity; the one who leads, with diligence; the one who does acts of mercy, with cheerfulness.

verses.latin: Dilectio sine simulatione. Odi propter quod malum est: adhaerentes bono.
verses.english: Let love be genuine; hate what is evil, hold fast to what is good.

verses.latin: Fraternitatis amore invicem diligentes: honore invicem praevenientes.
verses.english: Love one another with brotherly affection; outdo one another in showing honor.

verses.latin: Sollicitudine non pigri: spiritu ferventes: Domino servientes:
verses.english: Never flag in zeal, be aglow with the Spirit, serve the Lord.

verses.latin: spe gaudentes: in tribulatione patientes: orationi instantes:
verses.english: Rejoice in your hope, be patient in tribulation, be constant in prayer.

verses.latin: necessitatibus sanctorum communicantes: hospitalitatem sectantes.
verses.english: Contribute to the needs of the saints, practice hospitality.

verses.latin: Benedicite persequentibus vos: benedicite, et nolite maledicere.
verses.english: Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse them.

verses.latin: Gaudere cum gaudentibus: flere cum flentibus:
verses.english: Rejoice with those who rejoice, weep with those who weep.

verses.latin: Idipsum invicem sentientes: non altum sapientes, sed humilibus consentientes. Noli esse prudentes apud vosmetipsos.
verses.english: Live in harmony with one another; do not be haughty, but associate with the lowly; never be wise in your own sight.

verses.latin: Neminem malum pro malo reddentes: providentes bona non tantum coram Deo, sed etiam coram omnibus hominibus.
verses.english: Repay no one evil for evil, but take thought for what is noble in the sight of all.

verses.latin: Si fieri potest, quod ex vobis est, cum omnibus hominibus pacem habentes.
verses.english: If possible, so far as it depends upon you, live peaceably with all.

verses.latin: Non vosmetipsos defendentes, carissimi: sed date locum irae. Scriptum est enim: Mihi vindicta: ego retribuam, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Beloved, never avenge yourselves, but leave it to the wrath of God; for it is written, “Vengeance is mine, I will repay,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ideo si esurierit inimicus tuus, ciba illum: si sitit, potum da illi: hoc enim faciens, carbones ignis congregabis super caput ejus.
verses.english: To the contrary, “if your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him drink; for by so doing you will heap burning coals on his head.”

verses.latin: Noli vinci a malo, sed vince in bono malum.
verses.english: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

verses.latin: Omnis anima potestatibus sublimioribus subdita sit: non est enim potestas nisi a Deo: quae autem sunt, a Deo ordinata sunt.
verses.english: Everyone should be obedient to the governing authorities. No authority exists that doesn’t come from God. The authorities that do exist are established by God.

verses.latin: Itaque qui resistit potestati, Dei ordinationi resistit: qui autem resistunt, ipsi sibi damnationem acquirunt.
verses.english: Consequently, whoever resists authority is resisting God’s will, and those who resist will bring judgment on themselves.

verses.latin: Nam principes non sunt timori boni operis, sed mali. Vis autem non timere potestatem? Fac bonum: et habebis laudem ex illa.
verses.english: Leaders are not a terror to good behavior, but to evil. Would you like to be unafraid of authority? Do good, and you will have praise from it.

verses.latin: Dei enim minister est tibi in bonum. Si autem malum feceris, time: non enim frustra gladium portat. Dei enim minister est: vindex in iram ei qui male agit.
verses.english: For the governing authority is God’s servant for your good. But if you do evil, be afraid, for the authority doesn’t carry the sword for nothing. It is God’s servant to execute wrath on anyone who does evil.

verses.latin: Ideo necesse est subditos esse, non solum propter iram, sed etiam propter conscientiam.
verses.english: So it is necessary to be obedient, not only because of God's wrath, but also because of your conscience.

verses.latin: Ideo enim et tributa praestatis: ministri enim Dei sunt, in hoc ipsum servientes.
verses.english: For this reason you also pay taxes. For the authorities are ministers of God, serving you by these things.

verses.latin: Reddite omnibus debita: cui tributum, tributum: cui vectigal, vectigal: cui timorem, timorem: cui honorem, honorem.
verses.english: Give to everyone what is owed: Taxes to whom taxes are owed, revenue to whom revenue is owed, respect to whom respect is owed, honor to whom honor is owed.

verses.latin: Nemini quidquam debeatis, nisi ut invicem diligatis: qui enim diligit proximum, legem implevit.
verses.english: Owe nothing to anyone except to love one another. For whoever loves their neighbor has fulfilled the Law.

verses.latin: Hoc enim: Non adulterabis: non occides: non furaberis: non falsum testimonium dices: non concupisces: et si quod aliud mandatum est, in hoc verbo instauratur: Diliges proximum tuum sicut teipsum.
verses.english: For the commandments, “You shall not commit adultery, you shall not murder, you shall not steal, you shall not bear false witness, you shall not covet,” and if there is any other commandment, are summed up in this word: “Love your neighbor as yourself.”

verses.latin: Dilectio proximi malum non operatur. Plenitudo ergo legis est dilectio.
verses.english: Love does no evil to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfillment of the Law.

verses.latin: Et hoc scientes tempus: quia hora est jam nos de somno surgere. Nunc enim propior est nobis salus, quam cum credidimus.
verses.english: Do this, knowing the time. It is now the hour to awaken from sleep. For salvation is closer to us now than when we first believed.

verses.latin: Nox praecessit, dies autem appropinquavit. Abiciamus ergo opera tenebrarum, et induamur arma lucis.
verses.english: The night is far gone, and the day is near. Therefore let us cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the weapons of light.

verses.latin: Sicut in die honeste ambulemus: non in comessationibus, et ebrietatibus, non in cubilibus et impudicitiis, non in contentione et aemulatione:
verses.english: Let us walk honestly, as in the day, not in carousing and drunkenness, not in sexual relations and indecency, not in strife and envy.

verses.latin: sed induamini Dominum Jesum Christum: et carnis provissionem ne feceritis in concupiscentiis.
verses.english: Instead, put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, to fulfill its desires.

verses.latin: Suscipite infirmum in fide, non in contentionibus cogitationum.
verses.english: Welcome those who are weak in the faith, but do not argue about questionable matters.

verses.latin: Alius enim credit se manducare omnia: qui autem infirmus est, olus manducet.
verses.english: One person believes he can eat anything. Someone who is weak, however, eats only vegetables.

verses.latin: Qui manducat, non manducantem non spernat: et qui non manducat, manducantem non judicet. Deus enim illum suscepit.
verses.english: The one who eats should not despise the one who does not. The one who does not eat should not judge the one who does. God welcomes both.

verses.latin: Tu quis es qui judicas alienum servum? Domino suo stat, aut cadit: stabit autem: potens est enim Deus statuere illum.
verses.english: Who are you to judge someone else's servant? The servant stands or falls before his own master. And he will stand, for God has the power to make him stand.

verses.latin: Nam alius judicat diem inter diem: alius autem judicat omnem diem. Unusquisque in suo sensu abundet.
verses.english: One person values one day above another; another esteems every day alike. Each one should be fully convinced in his own mind.

verses.latin: Qui sapit diem, Domino sapit: et qui manducat, Domino manducat: gratias enim agit Deo. Et qui non manducat, Domino non manducat, et gratias agit Deo.
verses.english: The one who values the day, does so in honor of the Lord. The one who eats, eats in honor of the Lord, since he gives thanks to God; and the one who abstains, abstains in honor of the Lord and gives thanks to God.

verses.latin: Nemo enim nostrum sibi vivit, et nemo sibi moritur.
verses.english: For none of us lives for himself, and no one dies for himself.

verses.latin: Si enim vivimus, Domino vivimus: si morimur, Domino morimur. Sive ergo vivimus, sive morimur, Domini sumus.
verses.english: If we live, we live for the Lord, and if we die, we die for the Lord; so then, whether we live or die, we are the Lord's.

verses.latin: In hoc enim Christus mortuus est, et resurrexit: ut et mortuorum et vivorum dominetur.
verses.english: For this is why Christ died and came back to life, that he might be Lord both of the dead and of the living.

verses.latin: Tu autem quid judicas fratrem tuum? aut tu quare spernis fratrem tuum? Omnes enim stabimus ante tribunal Christi.
verses.english: But you, why do you judge your brother? Or you, why do you despise your brother? For we will all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

verses.latin: Scriptum est enim: Vivo ego, dicit Dominus, quoniam mihi flectet omnis genu, et omnis lingua confitebitur Deo.
verses.english: For it is written: “As I live, says the Lord, every knee will bend to me, and every tongue will give praise to God.”

verses.latin: Itaque unusquisque nostrum pro se rationem reddet Deo.
verses.english: So then each of us will give an account of himself to God.

verses.latin: Non ergo amplius nos invicem judicemus: sed hoc judicate magis, ne ponatis offendiculum fratri, vel scandalum.
verses.english: Therefore, let us no longer pass judgment on one another, but rather decide never to put a stumbling block or hindrance in the way of a brother.

verses.latin: Scio, et confido in Domino Jesu, quia nihil commune per semet ipsum: nisi ei qui existimat aliquid commune, illi immundum est.
verses.english: I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean in itself. But it is unclean for anyone who thinks it unclean.

verses.latin: Si enim propter cibum frater tuus contristatur, jam non secundum caritatem ambulas. Noli cibo tuo illum perdere, pro quo Christus mortuus est.
verses.english: For if your brother is grieved by what you eat, you are no longer walking in love. Do not destroy with your food the one for whom Christ died.

verses.latin: Noli ergo blasphemetur bonum vestrum.
verses.english: So do not let your good be slandered.

verses.latin: Non est enim regnum Dei esca et potus, sed justitia, et pax, et gaudium in Spiritu Sancto.
verses.english: For the kingdom of God is not food and drink, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Qui enim in hoc servit Christo, placet Deo, et probatus est hominibus.
verses.english: For whoever serves Christ in this way is acceptable to God and approved by men.

verses.latin: Itaque, quæ pacis sunt, sectemur: et quæ ædificationis sunt, invicem custodiamus.
verses.english: So then, let us pursue the things which make for peace and the things by which one may edify another.

verses.latin: Noli propter escam destruas opus Dei. Omnia quidem munda sunt: sed malum est homini qui per offendiculum manducat.
verses.english: Do not, for the sake of food, destroy the work of God. All things indeed are clean, but it is wrong for anyone to make others stumble by what he eats.

verses.latin: Bonum est non manducare carnem, et non bibere vinum, neque in quo frater tuus offendit, aut scandalizatur, aut infirmatur.
verses.english: It is good not to eat meat or drink wine or do anything by which your brother stumbles.

verses.latin: Tu fidem habes? Habe apud te ipsum coram Deo. Beatus qui non judicat semet ipsum in eo quod probat.
verses.english: The faith that you have, have as your own conviction before God. Blessed is the one who does not condemn himself in what he approves.

verses.latin: Qui autem discernit, si manducaverit, damnatus est: quia non ex fide. Omne autem, quod non est ex fide, peccatum est.
verses.english: But whoever has doubts is condemned if he eats, because the eating is not from faith. For whatever does not proceed from faith is sin.

verses.latin: Debemus autem nos, qui fortes sumus, imbecillitates infirmorum sustinere, et non nobis placere.
verses.english: And we who are strong in faith must bear with the weaknesses of those who are not strong, and not seek to please ourselves.

verses.latin: Unusquisque vestrum proximo suo placeat in bonum, ad aedificationem.
verses.english: Each of us should please his neighbor for his good, for building up.

verses.latin: Etenim Christus non sibi placuit, sed sicut scriptum est: Improperia exprobrantium tibi ceciderunt super me.
verses.english: For even Christ did not please Himself, but as it is written: “The reproaches of those who reproach You fell on Me.”

verses.latin: Quaecumque enim scripta sunt, ad nostram doctrinam scripta sunt: ut per patientiam et consolationem Scripturarum spem habeamus.
verses.english: For whatever things were written, were written for our teaching, that through patience and the consolation of the Scriptures, we may have hope.

verses.latin: Deus autem patientiae et consolationis det vobis idipsum sapere in alterutrum secundum Jesum Christum:
verses.english: Now may the God of patience and consolation grant you to be of one mind with one another, according to Jesus Christ:

verses.latin: ut unanimes uno ore honorificetis Deum et Patrem Domini nostri Jesu Christi.
verses.english: That with one accord you may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Propter quod suscipite invicem, sicut et Christus suscepit vos in honorem Dei.
verses.english: Therefore, receive one another, just as Christ also received us, to the glory of God.

verses.latin: Dico enim Christum Jesum ministrum fuisse circumcisionis propter veritatem Dei, ad confirmandas promissiones patrum,
verses.english: For I say that Christ Jesus has been a servant to the circumcision for the sake of God’s truth, to confirm the promises made to the fathers,

verses.latin: gentes autem propter misericordiam honorare Deum, sicut scriptum est: Propterea confitebor tibi in gentibus, et nomini tuo cantabo.
verses.english: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for His mercy, as it is written: “Therefore I will give thanks to You among the Gentiles, and sing to Your name.”

verses.latin: Et iterum dicit: Laetamini gentes cum plebe ejus.
verses.english: And again, he says: “Rejoice, O Gentiles, with His people.”

verses.latin: Et iterum: Laudate omnes gentes Dominum, et magnificet eum omnes populi.
verses.english: And again: “Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles, and let all the peoples praise Him.”

verses.latin: Et rursum Isaias ait: Erit radix Jesse, et qui exsurget regere gentes, in eum gentes sperabunt.
verses.english: And again, Isaiah says: “There shall be the root of Jesse, and He who shall rise to rule over the Gentiles; in Him the Gentiles shall hope.”

verses.latin: Deus autem spei repleat vos omni gaudio et pace in credendo: ut abundetis in spe, in virtute Spiritus Sancti.
verses.english: Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Certus sum autem fratres mei et ego ipse de vobis, quoniam et ipsi pleni estis bonitate, repleti omni scientia, potentes alios docere.
verses.english: And I myself am confident concerning you, my brothers, that you also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to instruct one another.

verses.latin: Audacius autem scripsi vobis fratres, ex parte, tamquam qui vos in memoriam reducam, propter gratiam, quae data est mihi a Deo,
verses.english: But I have written to you more boldly, brothers, in some measure, as recalling you to your minds, because of the grace given to me by God,

verses.latin: ut sim minister Christi Jesu in gentibus: sanctificans Evangelium Dei, ut fiat oblatio gentium accepta, sanctificata in Spiritu Sancto.
verses.english: That I might be a minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, sanctifying the Gospel of God, that the offering of the Gentiles might be made acceptable, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Habeo igitur gloriam in Christo Jesu, in iis quae sunt ad Deum.
verses.english: Therefore, I have glory in Christ Jesus concerning the things of God.

verses.latin: Non enim audeo aliquid loqui eorum, quae per me non efficit Christus in obediendum gentium, verbo et factis,
verses.english: For I will not dare to speak of anything except what Christ has worked through me, for the obedience of the Gentiles, by word and deed,

verses.latin: in virtute signorum et prodigiorum, in virtute Spiritus Sancti: ita ut ab Jerusalem per circuitum usque Illyricum adimpleverim Evangelium Christi.
verses.english: In the power of signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem and round about as far as Illyricum, I have fulfilled the Gospel of Christ.

verses.latin: Et sic praedicantem Evangelium, non ubi nominatus est Christus, ne super alienum fundamentum aedificarem,
verses.english: And I have preached the Gospel in this way, not where Christ was named, lest I should build on another’s foundation,

verses.latin: sed sicut scriptum est: Quibus non est nuntiatum de eo, videbunt: et qui non audierunt, intelleget.
verses.english: But as it is written: “They to whom He was not announced, shall see: and those who have not heard, shall understand.”

verses.latin: Propter quod et impediebar plurimum venire ad vos.
verses.english: Because of this also I have been hindered many times from coming to you.

verses.latin: Nunc vero ulterius locum non habens in his regionibus, desiderium habens venire ad vos ex multis jam annis,
verses.english: But now, not having any more place in these regions, and having a desire to come to you for many years,

verses.latin: cum in Hispaniam proficiscar: spero enim praeteriens vos, ire in Hispaniam, et per vos deduci illuc, si prius vestrorum partem satiatus fuero.
verses.english: Whenever I go to Spain, I hope that by passing through you, I may see you and be helped on my way there by you, after I have first enjoyed your company for a while.

verses.latin: Nunc autem proficiscor in Jerusalem, ministrare sanctis.
verses.english: But now I am going to Jerusalem, to minister to the saints.

verses.latin: Etenim Macedonia et Achaia, collationem aliquam fecerunt in pauperes sanctorum, qui sunt in Jerusalem.
verses.english: For Macedonia and Achaia have been pleased to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Placuit enim eis: et debitores eorum sunt. Nam si gentilium spiritualium consortium fecerunt, debent et in carnalibus ministrare eis.
verses.english: For it has pleased them, and they are their debtors. For if the Gentiles have shared in their spiritual things, they also ought to minister to them in material things.

verses.latin: Hoc igitur cum consummavero, et consignavero eis fructum hunc, per vos ibo in Hispaniam.
verses.english: Therefore, when I have finished this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will pass through you into Spain.

verses.latin: Scio autem quoniam veniens ad vos, in abundantia benedictionis Christi veniam.
verses.english: But I know that when I come to you, I shall come in the fullness of the blessing of Christ.

verses.latin: Obsecro autem vos fratres, per Dominum nostrum Jesum Christum, et per caritatem Spiritus, ut adiuvetis me in orationibus pro me ad Deum,
verses.english: Now I beg you, brothers, through our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in your prayers to God for me,

verses.latin: ut liberer a non credentibus qui sunt in Judaea, et ut obsequium meus, quod est in Jerusalem, sit acceptum sanctis.
verses.english: That I may be delivered from those who do not believe in Judea, and that my service for Jerusalem may be accepted by the saints.

verses.latin: ut veniam ad vos in gaudio per voluntatem Dei, et refrigerer vobiscum.
verses.english: That I may come to you with joy by the will of God, and may be refreshed with you.

verses.latin: Deus autem pacis sit cum omnibus vobis. Amen.
verses.english: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.

verses.latin: Commendo autem vobis Phoeben sororem nostram, quae est in ministerio ecclesiae, quae est in Cenchris:
verses.english: I commend to you Phoebe, a sister of ours who serves the church in Cenchrae:

verses.latin: ut eam suscipiatis in Domino digne sanctorum: et assistatis ei in quocumque negotio illa vestri egeat: siquidem et ipsa praes/tatrix fuit multorum, et mihi ipsi.
verses.english: Welcome her in the Lord, as is fitting for the saints. Assist her with whatever business she needs. She has been a patron of many, including me.

verses.latin: Salutate Priscam et Aquilam, adjutores meos in Christo Jesu,
verses.english: Greet Prisca and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus,

verses.latin: qui pro anima mea cervicem suam supposuerunt: quibus non solus ego gratias ago, sed et omnes ecclesiae gentium:
verses.english: who risked their necks for my life. I thank not only them but also all the churches of the Gentiles.

verses.latin: et ecclesiam, quae est in domo eorum. Salutate Epaenetum dilectum meum, qui est primitiae Asiae in Christo.
verses.english: Also greet the church that meets in their house. Greet my beloved Epaenetus, who was the first in Asia to believe in Christ.

verses.latin: Salutate Mariam, quae multum laboravit in vobis.
verses.english: Greet Mary, who has worked hard for you.

verses.latin: Salutate Andronicum et Juniam cognatos et concaptivos meos: qui sunt nobiles in Apostolis, qui et ante me fuerunt in Christo.
verses.english: Greet Andronicus and Junia, my relatives and fellow prisoners, who are well-known among the apostles and were in Christ before I was.

verses.latin: Salutate Ampliatum dilectissimum mihi in Domino.
verses.english: Greet Ampliatus, my beloved in the Lord.

verses.latin: Salutate Urbanum adjutorem nostrum in Christo Jesu: et Stachyn dilectum meum.
verses.english: Greet Urban, our fellow worker in Christ Jesus, and my beloved Stachys.

verses.latin: Salutate Apellen probatum in Christo. Salutate eos, qui sunt ex Aristobuli domo.
verses.english: Greet Apelles, approved in Christ. Greet those of the household of Aristobulus.

verses.latin: Salutate Herodiònem cognatum meum. Salutate eos, qui sunt ex Narcissi domo, qui sunt in Domino.
verses.english: Greet Herodion, my relative. Greet those of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.

verses.latin: Salutate Tryphaenam et Tryphosam, qui laborant in Domino. Salutate Persidem carissimam, quae multum laboravit in Domino.
verses.english: Greet Tryphaena and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Greet the beloved Persis, who has worked hard in the Lord.

verses.latin: Salutate Rufum electum in Domino, et matrem ejus et meam.
verses.english: Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

verses.latin: Salutate Asyncritum, Phlegonta, Hermam, Patroban, Hermen, et fratres, qui cum eis sunt.
verses.english: Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brothers who are with them.

verses.latin: Salutate Philologum, et Juliam, Nereum, et sororem ejus, et Olympam, et omnes sanctos qui cum eis sunt.
verses.english: Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.

verses.latin: Salutate invicem in osculo sancto. Salutant vos omnes ecclesiae Christi.
verses.english: Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ greet you.

verses.latin: Rogo autem vos fratres, ut observetis eos, qui dissensiones et offendicula faciunt contra doctrinam, quam vos didicistis, et declinate ab illis.
verses.english: Now I urge you, brothers, to watch out for those who cause divisions and create obstacles contrary to the teaching that you learned, and turn away from them.

verses.latin: Hi enim, qui tales sunt, Christo Domino nostro non serviunt, sed suo ventri: et per dulces sermones et benedictiones seducunt corda innocentium.
verses.english: For such people do not serve our Lord Christ, but their own appetites, and they deceive the hearts of the innocent with smooth talk and flattery.

verses.latin: Vestra enim oboedientia in omnem locum divulgata est. Gaudeo igitur de vobis. Volo autem vos sapientes esse in bono, et simplices in malo.
verses.english: Your obedience has become known to everyone. Therefore, I rejoice over you, and I want you to be wise in what is good and innocent in what is evil.

verses.latin: Deus autem pacis conterat Satanam sub pedibus vestris velociter. Gratia Domini nostri Jesu Christi vobiscum.
verses.english: The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

verses.latin: Salutant vos Timotheus, adjutor meus, et Lucius, et Jason, et Sosipater, cognati mei.
verses.english: Timothy, my fellow worker, and Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my relatives, greet you.

verses.latin: Saluto vos in Domino ego Tertius, qui scripsi epistolam.
verses.english: I, Tertius, who wrote this letter, greet you in the Lord.

verses.latin: Salutat vos Gaius hospes meus, et universa ecclesia. Salutat vos Erastus, oeconomus civitatis, et Quartus frater.
verses.english: Gaius, my host and the host of the whole church, greets you. Erastus, the city treasurer, and our brother Quartus greet you.

verses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri Jesu Christi cum omnibus vobis. Amen.
verses.english: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you. Amen.

verses.latin: Ei autem, qui potens est vos confirmare juxta Evangelium meum, et praedicationem Jesu Christi, secundum revelationem mysterii, temporibus aeternis  silentii, manifestati
verses.english: Now to him who is able to strengthen you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery kept secret for ages,

verses.latin: (quod nunc manifestatum est per scripturas propheticas, secundum praeceptum Dei aeterni, ad obediendum fidei), in omnibus gentibus, notum factum,
verses.english: but now revealed and made known through the prophetic writings by the command of the eternal God, to bring about the obedience of faith among all the nations—

verses.latin: soli sapienti Deo, per Jesum Christum: cui gloria in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
verses.english: to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, be glory forever! Amen.
